testimony.name: Dorothy Windham
key_points: Concern about rising cost of housing for young people
Support for City of Yes plan to allow New York to grow
Excitement about creation of permanent affordable housing through UIP proposal
Support for re-legalization of new NRSROs
Belief that growth is necessary for New York's future
Concern about consequences of not building new housing (higher prices, struggling businesses, families squeezed or moving away)
Hope that City of Yes will make living in New York more affordable

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: I'm particularly excited about the creation of permanent affordable housing through the UIP proposal
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker directly mentions the UAP (referred to as UIP, likely a misspeak) and expresses support for its goal of creating permanent affordable housing, which aligns with the proposal's intention.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: as well as the re legalization of new NRSROs
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker mentions 're legalization of new NRSROs', which likely refers to Non-Residential Space Residential Occupancy, a concept related to residential conversions. This aligns with the proposal's aim to convert non-residential spaces into housing.
